intro: Rima, commonly known as the "ghost flower," is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent petals that resemble thin, ghostly veils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom only under specific environmental conditions, making it difficult to study.
